channel.title: Apple and Nintendo coming together?
channel.description:
Between howling at the moon, these looneys point to the similar corporate philosophies of Apple and Nintendo (bull-headed determination in the face of defeat); the similar consumer perception of the companies (both have followings whose brand dedication verges on the religiously devout); the similar design styles (the Nintendo DS Lite practically looks like Jonathan Ive built it); and the complementary market spaces (Apple wants games, Nintendo wants style). But somewhere in the looney's mind, is there a scintilla of logic? A tiny fragment of truth spluttering for breath in the soup of madness? Could Apple actually buy Nintendo, and more importantly, why would it want to?
[i]Source:[/i] http://crave.cnet.co.uk/digitalmusic/0,39029432,49276362,00.htm?r=1 I hope the Mac Mini part comes true ;o

Nintendo would never sell to apple. They dont see eye to eye.

Nintendo likes to be cheap (price wise) apple does not

Nintendo likes to make games for everyone, Apple seems to like hardware for the hardcore

item.title: Apple and Nintendo coming together?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:13, topic:134529”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=185926.msg1691828#msg1691828 date=1187792889]

Actually, by pointing out the fact that you make useless posts, I made a point. In making a point, my post was not useless.

Yes, but your point was useless -.-

This surprises me, Nintendo + Apple seems like a ridiculously lame idea.

Nintendo doesn’t need to be more user-friendly. And anyone who will buy a product based on external appearance is the utterly pathetic epitome of man.
[/quote]

Hmm… so say you want a lamp. Your just going to buy a lamp if it looks shit? Or you want a computer, theres a flashy one with a sexy looking case or theres a shitty one for the same price and same specs. You’re going to buy the nicer one. Nearly everything is bought depending on what it looks like; clothes, furniture, food.

So next time you make stupid comments, think about them.[/quote]
Wow, I have the stupid comment?

Use common sense, if you are buying an item for use as a decoration, such as a lamp, obviously you would buy the better looking one. If two computers are the same cost, same specs, and one looks better, obviously you will buy the better looking one.

If you could intelligently interpret my post, you would understand that I meant, for example, if two computers have the same specs, and the one that looks better costs an extra $400 (which I have seen time and time again), you are likely mentally deficient.

Read full topic
